response.name: Roasted Potatoes with Rosemary
ingredients: -1 1/2 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces
instructions: 2. Toss potatoes with olive oil, rosemary, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
3. Transfer to a rimmed baking sheet and roast, stirring once or twice, until potatoes are browned and tender, 25 to 30 minutes.

response.name: Classic Potato Gratin
ingredients: -Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: 1. Preheat your oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
2. Butter the bottom and sides of a baking dish generously with butter.
3. Arrange a layer of potato slices at the bottom of the dish, slightly overlapping each other.
4. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the heavy cream, minced garlic, nutmeg, thyme, salt, and black pepper.
5. Spoon some of the cream mixture over the layer of potatoes and sprinkle with a portion of the grated Gruyere cheese.
6. Repeat the process to create several layers, ending with the cream mixture and cheese on top.
7. Dot the top with small pieces of butter.
8. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour.
9. Remove the foil, and continue baking for another 20-30 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and the top is golden brown and bubbly.
10. Allow the potato gratin to rest for 10 minutes before serving.
